results.title: The Tigger movie [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Cheryl Abood and Jun Falkenstein
results.brief_description: When no-one will play with him Tigger sets out on a journey to find his family tree, and other Tiggers. This is harder than he thought and he quickly becomes discouraged. When his friends Winnie the Pooh, Eeyore, Owl, Kanga and Roo see that their friend is sad, they pretend to be the family he wishes for, by writing him a letter and dressing up as Tiggers. But when Tigger finds out who they really are, he becomes more determined to find his real family, and wanders out into a snowstorm. Roo, upset that he has lost his best friend, convinces the others to follow Tigger and show him that they are his real family. Based on classic characters created by A.A. Milne. This animated feature length film is filled with the songs, colour and movement that young children adore.

results.title: The Threepenny opera = L'opera de quat' sous. Die Dreigroschenoper
results.creator_credit: Tobis Filmkunst, Nero-Film, Warner Brothers First National Productions, Seymour Nebenzal and G Pabst
results.brief_description: In 19th Century London, Mack the Knife, a small-time criminal, marries Polly, the daughter of beggar-king, Peachum, and finds himself in a lot of trouble. In the early years of the sound era, film producers often made films in different language versions, using the same sets but different casts for each version. Pabst followed this practice with his twin versions of ‘The Threepenny Opera’ in German and French- ‘Die Driegroschenoper’(98 min.) and ‘L’Opera de Quat’ Sous’(105 min.). The two versions offer rich material for comparison. The German version was originally released in 1931 amidst political and legal controversy. The Nazis, rankled by its socialist message and attacks on government authority, ordered the destruction of the original negative and every print that could be found. The film’s unavailability bolstered its legendary status and, after many years of searching, a complete negative was found and a restored version released in 1960. Music by Kurt Weill. From the play by Bertolt Brecht and Kurt Weill. In French and German with English subtitles.

results.title: The Three musketeers
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Pandro S. Berman and George Sidney
results.brief_description: The third talkie version of Alexander Dumas famed story of D’Artagnan - a young man seeking his fortune in 17th Century France. MGM created a splashy production with an all-star cast for this swashbuckling adventure movie, filmed in Technicolor. Gene Kelly gives the impression of having a fabulous time playing the title role of a young anti-authoritarian upstart, a talented swordsman with an eye for attractive ladies of the Court. D’Artagnan joins the three musketeers, Athos, Porthos and Aramis, in order to save their beleageared queen from disgrace. To do so they much face the Machiavellian Milady De Winter and Richelieu. The film, a curious mix of melodrama and burlesque, was one of the top earning films of 1948.

results.title: The Three faces of Eve
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Nunnally Johnson
results.brief_description: Joanne Woodward, in a performance which earned her the Oscar for Best Actress, plays Eve White, a mousy withdrawn housewife with multiple personalities. After startling her husband by behaving completely out of character, and having blackouts, Eve visits a psychiatrist, played by Lee J. Cobb. From these sessions, emerges the personality of Eve Black, a sexy, uninhibited woman who expresses those parts of Eve White’s personality which she has suppressed. Eventually, her third self emerges as Jane; an intelligent, sensible woman, who helps resolve and integrate the different facets of Eve’s personality into a whole and healthy human being. Based on a true story, this acclaimed drama explores the dimensions of the human mind.

results.title: The Thomas Crown affair
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Irish Dreamtime, Pierce Brosnan, Beau St Clair and John McTiernan
results.brief_description: This remake of the Steve McQueen movie of the same name stars Pierce Brosnan as thrill-seeking billionaire Thomas Crown. Bored with his life, he decides to stage a daring robbery and steal a priceless painting in broad daylight from one of the most secure museums in the world. Rene Russo stars as his nemesis - insurance investigator Catherine Manning, a woman who is every bit as intelligent, cunning and hungry for adventure as he is - and she will need to be is she is to outwit this master thief. Certain clues point to Crown, so Danning introduces herself into Crown’s social circle. Police detective Michael McCann (Denis Leary) warns Danning that Crown can easily draw people in with his effortless charm, and getting to close him will not be good for her investigation. She is amused by McCann’s suggestion — until she finds herself falling for Crown.

results.title: The Thirteenth floor
results.creator_credit: Centropolis Entertainment, Ute Emmerich, Roland Emmerich, Marco Weber and Josef Rusnak
results.brief_description: Hannon Fuller is a scientist intrigued by time-travel who designs a virtual reality program that allows the player to assume an identity in another era and experience first hand the milieu of the times. Unbeknownst to his co-worker Douglas Hall, Fuller has been using the software, downloading himself into Los Angeles 1937 - the setting of his childhood. When Fuller is brutally knifed to death one night, Hall is suspected of murder. Hall decides to travel back to 1937 to recover a message that Fuller has left for him in the system and hopefully identify the real killer. As the principal characters travel through time, they struggle to maintain their 1930s identities and face the danger of ruining their creation by exposing the game. “The Thirteenth floor” is a science fiction thriller that mimics the technical babble and mind-bending logic of “The Matrix” and “eXistenZ”, without ever really managing to achieve the accomplishments of those finer examples of the genre. The film, stylish in its recreation of the 1930s era and the computer saturated sleekness of the 90s, melds noirish aesthetics, romance, murder mystery and sci-fi adventuring.

results.title: The Third man
results.creator_credit: London Film Productions and Carol Reed
results.brief_description: A lucky combination of talents gave this romantic thriller, set in war-torn Vienna, an almost poetic quality and an excitement which has kept it vivid. The photogenic ruins provided a suitable background for the four star actors: Joseph Cotton, Valli, Trevor Howard and Orson Welles. Graham Greene wrote a bitter, well-timed script adapted from his own novel, Robert Krasker lovingly photographed and Carol Reed directed every scene with the surest of touches and then there was the insistent zither music by Anton Karas.

results.title: The Things of life = Les choses de la vie
results.creator_credit: Fida Cinematografica, Jean Bolvary, Raymond Danon, Roland Girard, Claude Sautet and Lira Films
results.brief_description: Pierre (Michel Piccoli) has a collision at a roadside intersection and as he battles for his life on the way to hospital, he reflects back on his life, particularly his relationships with his wife (Lea Massari) and his mistress (Romy Schneider). Sautet is a master of a refined form of bourgeois melodrama in which protagonists are jolted out of security and forced to re-examine the meaning of their lives and the value of marriage, family and love. In many ways, “Les Choses de la Vie”, made in 1969, takes the departures allowed for by the radical events of May 1968 not as a means for subverting aesthetics, but for examining the shifts this caused for middle-class morality and values. Pierre is torn by the duties he feels towards love and his duties as a father and husband to his son and wife. His recollections are all part of attempting to reconcile his conflicting desires with the truth of his own mortality. The film is based on the novel by Paul Guimard and the elegant film score is by Philippe Sarde. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Thin man
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Cosmopolitan, Hunt Stromberg and W S. Van Dyke
results.brief_description: Dashiell Hammett’s 1932 detective novel, “The thin man”, was a best- seller sought by every major Hollywood studio. MGM won out and the result is a crime thriller combined with high comedy. As Nick and Nora Charles, the wisecracking darlings of society, William Powell and Myrna Loy made history portraying two sophisticates who are not only married but also very much in love, also stars Cesar Romero.

results.title: The Texas chainsaw massacre = The Texas chain saw massacre
results.brief_description: Loosely based on the grizzly exploits of American serial killer Ed Gein (also a model for Norman Bates in “Psycho”), Tobe Hooper’s “The Texas chain saw massacre” rightly deserves its place as a horror classic. Five teenagers travelling through Texas (two of them brother and sister investigating the mysterious desecration of their grandfather’s grave), pick up a creepy hitchhiker and find themselves embroiled in a macabre and nightmarish reverse of southern hospitality. From its eerie opening images to its shocking finale, “The Texas chain saw massacre’ was initially considered a cheap drive-in exploitation film but, through strong critical appraisal, went on to be screened as part of the director’s fortnight at Cannes and the American Museum of Modern Art now has a print of it in its permanent collection. Cast includes Marilyn Burns, Allen Danziger and Gunnar Hansen as Leatherface. Please note: special features are contained on disk two.
